events.message: The customer reported a car accident on the highway involving another vehicle, resulting in visible damage to their front bumper and hood.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords related to vehicle collision and damages.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the case to guide the customer through the claims process swiftly and clearly.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed that the investigation would begin shortly.
To process the claim, the customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police reports, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including high-resolution images and a detailed accident report.
The claims investigator began assessing the submitted documents along with contacting the involved parties for additional information.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and verified the extent of damages to the vehicle.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to cover full repairs of the damaged parts and a rental vehicle during repair time.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciated the quick and transparent communication.
Management approved the claim based on investigation findings and customer feedback, confirming the full payout.
The payment was issued to the repair shop and rental company as per the settlement terms agreed upon with the customer.
The claim file was closed after confirming that repairs were completed satisfactorily and all invoices fully settled.
The complete claim documentation was archived securely for future reference and compliance with company policies.
